sentences.sentence: Blair was an interventionist by temperament.
sentences.translation: 布莱尔从性格上讲是个干涉主义者。

sentences.sentence: Mr Bush backed this, in violation of his own anti-interventionist impulses.
sentences.translation: 布什先生对此表示了支持，尽管这与他一贯反对干涉市场自由的理念相违背。

sentences.sentence: Interventionist policies aimed at sustaining export competitiveness expand economies.
sentences.translation: 旨在保持出口竞争力的干预主义政策促进了经济增长。
